channel.title: Evolution or Religion?
channel.description:
Well, my world history teacher raised the question: "Why are we here? How did we get here?" The theory of Evolution that was stated by Charles Darwin had some information that said the we evolved from apes. Personally, I believe in evolution, but I don't agree with the statement the humans evolved from apes.
I found a published timeline that shows the evolution of so-called humans. The first step on the chart is an ape by the name of [i][b]Austrolopithices[/b][/i]( I don't know if I spelled the right way). Now, during the the time period of [i][b]Austrolopithices[/b][/i], the next step of the evolution chain came around. The next step of the chain is an ape by the name of [i][b]Homo Habilis[/b][/i], which stood a little more upright and had a larger brain. After [i][b]Homo Habilis [/b] [/i] came around, an ape by the name of [i]Homo Erectus [/i] came to be. This ancestor of [i][b]Homo Habilis [/b] [/i] stood even more upright, had a larger brain, and started using tools and mastered fire. Now we are on the forth step of the evolutionary chain. By now, [i][b]Austrolopithices [/b] [/i] has long since died out and so has [i][b]Homo Habilis[/b][/i]. [i][b]Homo Erectus[/b][/i] is still around. The forth step of this evolutionary chain is an a being known as [i][b][b]Neanderthol [/b] [/b] [/i] (the cavemen on Geico commercials :D), which survived til about 40,000 B.C.. Now why did this species die out. The fact is a new species, [i][b]Cro-Magnon[/b][/i], out-performed the [i][b]Neanderthol[/b][/i]. [i][b]Cro-Magnon [/b] [/i] is the modern human being, what we are. The problem is that the [i][b]Cro-Magnon [/b] [/i] species did not evolve from [b][i]Neanderthols[/i][/b]. Basically, the modern human species popped up out of nowhere 40,000 years ago.
So how did we get here? We, the human species, obviously did not come of evolution. The Bible stats that we all came from a higher being, God as you know him. But where did God come from? How could He have possibly been here before we were? The fact is, Neither evolution or reliogion can give us a concrete answer to how we came to be.
Honestly, I don't belive that there will ever be an answer of how we got here, how all of this got here. How did the universe come to be? Are we the only higher life forms in this distant thing that we know as the universe? As for the question of how we got here, there will never be enough evidence to give an aboslute truth to our existence.
Any responses? :confused:
P.S. I'm sorry about the incorrect spelling if there is any.

I’ve never heard of Muhammed not knowing about Christianity… Anywho, Islam and Christianity contradict each other alot too eg; Christians accept the Trinity, whilst Islamics do not. Islamics reject the idea of Jesus being God’s son.
[/quote]

All religions contradict within themselves also, what point are you trying to make?[/quote]

He was trying to say that Islam and Christianity go hand in hand and that proves that they are coorect, I told him that they also contradict each other. That is my point.

item.title: Evolution or Religion?
item.dc:creator: @juju juju
item.description:
@juju wrote:

[quote=“killerman93, post:171, topic:136384”][quote author=juju link=topic=187887.msg1737395#msg1737395 date=1189189242]
sigh. Firstly, evolution can not be considered a theistic religion, it could possibly be construed as a non-theistic religion - I do disagree with that view however, religion is defined as a “set of beliefs concerning the cause, nature, and purpose of the universe, esp. when considered as the creation of a superhuman agency or agencies, usually involving devotional and ritual observances, and often containing a moral code governing the conduct of human affairs.”, evolutionism/darwinsm does not entail any of these things.

Evolution has not finished and will never finish untill the day that the universe is destroyed. “Why have we not got wings or gills yet?” - because we have no need for them, a human with wings or gills will not be best-suited for the planet at this time eg; A child is born with genes(possibly through mutation) that cause him to grow fully functional gills, this person will face ridicule throughout his entire life and would most likely never see the outside of his 4x4x4 cage, it is highly probable that he will not find a “mate” and thus he will not be able to produce any offspring and have his genes passed on. That’s a pretty crap example, but I’d assume you get the gist atleast.

Here’s a nice little quote often reffered to as “Russell’s Teapot”(I suggest you read it thoroughly, then read it again): “f I were to suggest that between the Earth and Mars there is a china teapot revolving about the sun in an elliptical orbit, nobody would be able to disprove my assertion provided I were careful to add that the teapot is too small to be revealed even by our most powerful telescopes. But if I were to go on to say that, since my assertion cannot be disproved, it is an intolerable presumption on the part of human reason to doubt it, I should rightly be thought to be talking nonsense. If, however, the existence of such a teapot were affirmed in ancient books, taught as the sacred truth every Sunday, and instilled into the minds of children at school, hesitation to believe in its existence would become a mark of eccentricity and entitle the doubter to the attentions of the psychiatrist in an enlightened age or of the Inquisitor in an earlier time.”

Religion is often inherited from one’s parents.
[/quote]

But who decides that the planet is not suitable, non-other than God.

And if Religion is not true the why:
The prophet Muhammed(PBUH), did not read or write, he had no knowledge of christianity or its prophets.
Yet according to the Quran, every last prophet in the Bible is mentioned in the Quran.
Also, before the “Original Christians” were iradicated and Catholism developed, the Prophets brother-in-law was a Christian Scholar and Priest, he tol Khadeeja(Muhammed(PBUH)'s wife) that there would be a Third Book, mentioned by the Bible, this occured after the prophet ran home from his first encounter with Gabriel.
So how would the Muhammed(PBUH) have gained all this knowledge from the past.[/quote]

killerman93, it’s called natural selection for a reason, the idea that there has to be a governing body behind every action that occurs in the world is ludicrous. Wake up.

I’ve never heard of Muhammed not knowing about Christianity… Anywho, Islam and Christianity contradict each other alot too eg; Christians accept the Trinity, whilst Islamics do not. Islamics reject the idea of Jesus being God’s son.

Read full topic

That’s a pretty crap example, but I’d assume you get the gist atleast.

Yet according to the Quran, every last prophet in the Bible is mentioned in the Quran.

item.title: Evolution or Religion?
item.dc:creator: @juju juju
item.description:
@juju wrote:

[quote=“killerman93, post:169, topic:136384”]Im a muslim but, im against terrorism.
Muslims were made terrorists because Ben Laden interperated the Quran wrong.
We are not led by him.
Also some people are just jackasses in our religion.
Islam also explains, Jesus isnt the son of God, he is his messenger, his servant.
The idea of the trinity and all the myths that surround it e.g. ressurection and died again, king of the jews, had a son.
The romans were the ones who brought this idea in by mixing there religion and christianity.
Also isnt evolution in a way a non-practicing religion? People listened to prophets and people listened to Darwin.
In my opinion, evolution is a lie, we did not evolve from anything, apes and fish is what Darwin says our ancestors are, if so then why dont animals communicate with us, why have we not got wings or gills yet, or at least started to adapt a new form of life?
Because God gave us minds and souls (A mind is not a brain).[/quote]

sigh. Firstly, evolution can not be considered a theistic religion, it could possibly be construed as a non-theistic religion - I do disagree with that view however, religion is defined as a “set of beliefs concerning the cause, nature, and purpose of the universe, esp. when considered as the creation of a superhuman agency or agencies, usually involving devotional and ritual observances, and often containing a moral code governing the conduct of human affairs.”, evolutionism/darwinsm does not entail any of these things.

That’s a pretty crap example, but I’d assume you get the gist atleast.

Here’s a nice little quote often reffered to as “Russell’s Teapot”(I suggest you read it thoroughly, then read it again): “f I were to suggest that between the Earth and Mars there is a china teapot revolving about the sun in an elliptical orbit, nobody would be able to disprove my assertion provided I were careful to add that the teapot is too small to be revealed even by our most powerful telescopes. But if I were to go on to say that, since my assertion cannot be disproved, it is an intolerable presumption on the part of human reason to doubt it, I should rightly be thought to be talking nonsense. If, however, the existence of such a teapot were affirmed in ancient books, taught as the sacred truth every Sunday, and instilled into the minds of children at school, hesitation to believe in its existence would become a mark of eccentricity and entitle the doubter to the attentions of the psychiatrist in an enlightened age or of the Inquisitor in an earlier time.”

Religion is often inherited from one’s parents.

item.title: Evolution or Religion?
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

Iamadam:

Evolution involves the creation of new genetic information from nothing,

I don’t think that’s entirely accurate.

Read full topic

item.title: Evolution or Religion?
item.dc:creator: @juju juju
item.description:
@juju wrote:

Iamadam:

Natural selection and evolution are two completely different things. Evolution involves the creation of new genetic information from nothing, natural selection simply refines information that already exists (usually by either REMOVING it entirely, or damaging it so it is no longer functional).

What? In reality, of course, they are not completely different things, evolution occurs through natural selection or/and genetic drift.

Read full topic

item.title: Evolution or Religion?
item.dc:creator: @Iamadam Iamadam
item.description:
@Iamadam wrote:

Natural selection and evolution are two completely different things. Evolution involves the creation of new genetic information from nothing, natural selection simply refines information that already exists (usually by either REMOVING it entirely, or damaging it so it is no longer functional).

item.title: Evolution or Religion?
item.dc:creator: @daycrawler daycrawler
item.description:
@daycrawler wrote:

[quote=“xxlegitxx, post:162, topic:136384”][quote author=goatee link=topic=187887.msg1728730#msg1728730 date=1188832450]
Omg that was the stupidest thing I’ve ever heard. You don’t evolve because of the other people around you! Plus it would be easier and faster if we gave ourselves gills. Evolution is so slow it’s crap.
[/quote]

Evolution is not slow. If 0.000000033% of all the people in the world had the genes to extract oxygen from water with their lungs or skin, and everyone in the world jumped underwater, then after 30 minutes or so, the entire human species would be able to breathe underwater. Evolution is only perceived as slow in humans because of global travel and universal healthcare.

And I believe ace pilot was poking fun at daycrawler’s oversimplified and incorrect analysis of evolution, not at evolution itself. Though I could be wrong.[/quote]
Not really incorrect. I was trying to explain as simple as possible the general idea of adapatations in evolution.

Read full topic

item.title: Evolution or Religion?
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

phonnygoblin:

Everyone believes in natural selection, well most people? IDC if you don’t somebody else will prove it to you. The fact that natural selection exists is enough to prove that either: evolution exists, or that god exists and evolution still exists. You have to be a fucking retard to actually deny that evolution ever happened. It is possible that there is a god and is making us evolve, but imo thats the same fucking thing.

Well, macroevolution has yet to be proven. For all the scientists’ theorizing and hypothesizing, they have yet to have solid evidence proving macroevolution.

Read full topic

Why does evolution exclude religion or Christianity specifically?

Where-as evolution believes that we evolved and adapated to our surrondings. Like, their was insufficent food in the pond so the fish grew legs in order to adapt and live. They are contridactry things. That’s why Christianity is aganist evolution.
[/quote]

Sweet so if we got millions of people and started sitting at the bottom of the ocean eventually we would like breath under water from so many people dieing? just like how we evolved from dork fish?[/quote]

Omg that was the stupidest thing I’ve ever heard. You don’t evolve because of the other people around you! Plus it would be easier and faster if we gave ourselves gills. Evolution is so slow it’s crap.

item.title: Evolution or Religion?
